DSD_DAC2@DF_DAC3A.description:
This dataset provides aggregate statistics on the geographical distribution of bilateral and multilateral commitments of official development assistance (ODA) to developing countries and territories on the DAC List of ODA Recipients and multilateral agencies that are ODA-eligible. These data are presented by provider and partner country.

To assist with the transition between systems, we provide a mapping of codes between OECD.Stat (legacy) and the OECD Data Explorer. Please consult our database of development finance classifications for further information on all possible codes for each attribute. We also have a codebook for the DAC and CRS tables.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data. You may also be interested in our latest dashboards.

DSD_DAC2@DF_DAC4.name: DAC4: Private direct investment and other private capital
DSD_DAC2@DF_DAC4.description:
This dataset provides aggregate statistics on the geographical distribution of bilateral disbursements of private flows to developing countries and territories on the DAC List of ODA Recipients. Private flows are flows undertaken by firms and individuals residing in the reporting country.

To assist with the transition between systems, we provide a mapping of codes between OECD.Stat (legacy) and the OECD Data Explorer. Please consult our database of development finance classifications for further information on all possible codes for each attribute. We also have a codebook for the DAC and CRS tables.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data. You may also be interested in our latest dashboards.

DSD_DAC2@DF_ODF.name: Official development financing (ODF) by country and region
DSD_DAC2@DF_ODF.description:
Official Development Financing (ODF), measured for recipient countries only, is defined as the sum of their receipts of bilateral ODA, concessional and non-concessional resources from multilateral sources, and bilateral other official flows made available for reasons unrelated to trade, in particular loans to refinance debt.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data. You may also be interested in our latest dashboards.

DSD_DAC2@DF_OFFICIAL.name: Official flows by country and region
DSD_DAC2@DF_OFFICIAL.description:
This dataset provides aggregate statistics on official flows, which are the sum of official development assistance (ODA) and other official flows (OOF) disbursements to the recipient country shown.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data. You may also be interested in our latest dashboards.

DSD_DAC2@DF_RECPTS.name: Receipts by country and region
DSD_DAC2@DF_RECPTS.description:
This dataset provides information on partner countries' total net receipts of financial flows. These flows include official development assistance (ODA), other official flows (OOF), and changes in the bilateral long-term assets of the private non-monetary and monetary sectors (e.g., guaranteed export credits, private direct investment, portfolio investment and, to the extent they are not covered in the preceding headings, loans by private banks).

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data. You may also be interested in our latest dashboards.

DSD_GNDR@DF_GENDER.name: GenderMarkers: Aid (ODA) activities targeting gender equality and women's empowerment
DSD_GNDR@DF_GENDER.description:
This dataset contains bilateral data on aid (ODA) in support of gender equality and women's empowerment, using the OECD DAC Gender Equality policy marker, from the Development Assistance Committee (DAC) Creditor Reporting System (CRS). These data are available for commitments since 2002 and disbursements since 2009.

In their reporting to the DAC CRS, providers are requested to indicate for each activity whether or not it targets gender equality as one of its policy objectives. To qualify as "gender equality focused," an activity must explicitly promote gender equality and women's empowerment. An activity can target gender equality as its "principal" or "significant" objective, or not at all.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data.

DSD_GREQ@DF_CRS_GREQ.name: CRS: Creditor Reporting System grant equivalent
DSD_GREQ@DF_CRS_GREQ.description:
This dataset provides readily available, granular data on who is giving what aid, to where, and for what purpose, on a grant equivalent basis, and are available for data from 2018 onwards. These data are comparable across all providers who report their activity-level statistics to the OECD.

Please consult our database of development finance classifications for further information on all possible codes for each attribute.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data.

DSD_MOB@DF_MOBILISATION.name: CRS – Private: Mobilised private finance for development
DSD_MOB@DF_MOBILISATION.description:
This dataset presents information on amounts mobilised from the private sector from members' official sector interventions. The term "mobilisation" describes the causal link between private finance made available for a specific project and an official intervention.

Please consult our database of development finance classifications for further information on all possible codes for each attribute.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data.

DSD_MULTI@DF_MULTI.name: Providers' total use of the multilateral system
DSD_MULTI@DF_MULTI.description:
This dataset presents providers' total use of the multilateral system, including their multilateral aid ("Core contributions to") and bilateral aid channelled through multilateral organisations ("Contributions through"). These data originate from members' reporting to the Development Assistance Committee (DAC) Creditor Reporting System (CRS). These data are published starting with 2011 data – activity-level data for multilateral aid is not complete in CRS for earlier years.

Please consult our database of development finance classifications for further information on all possible codes for each attribute.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data.

Please note: the raw data, available under "Related files" below, has been updated on 06/02/2025 to reflect a correction related to the inclusion/exclusion of certain criteria, which affected the overall values for certain providers. Please refer to this file for the latest, corrected version.

DSD_OTHMRKR@DF_OTHERMARKERS.name: OtherMarkers: Aid activities targeting other policy objectives
DSD_OTHMRKR@DF_OTHERMARKERS.description:
This dataset contains bilateral commitment data on aid in support of five policy markers: 1) democratic and inclusive governance, 2) reproductive, maternal, newborn and child health (RMNCH), 3) nutrition, 4) inclusion and empowerment of persons with disabilities, and 5) disaster risk reduction (DRR) from the Development Assistance Committee (DAC) Creditor Reporting System (CRS) database.

In their reporting to the DAC CRS, donors are requested to indicate, for each activity, whether it targets the above-mentioned markers or not. A scoring system of three values is used, in which aid activities are marked as targeting the policy objective as either as the "principal" or "significant" objective, or not at all. Reporting is voluntary for the nutrition and disability markers.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data.

DSD_PPFD@DF_PPFD.name: Private Philanthropy for Development
DSD_PPFD@DF_PPFD.description:
This dataset provides project-level information for over 40 of the largest private philanthropic foundations working for development. The data is reported to the OECD's Development Co-operation Directorate, using the same statistical standards and definitions as for ODA.

For providers who are unable to share data on both commitments and disbursements, the missing flow type is proxied based on the one that is available. More details can be found at oe.cd/foundationsdata.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data.

DSD_QDD_DCD_IDRC@DF_QDD_DCD_IDRC.name: DAC members’ methodologies for reporting in-donor refugee costs in ODA
DSD_QDD_DCD_IDRC@DF_QDD_DCD_IDRC.description:
This dataset contains qualitative data on DAC members' methodologies for reporting in-donor refugee costs in ODA. It provides the possibility to gain insights in the various methodologies used, and to compare them among members.

The methodologies were collected and reviewed by the DAC Working Party on Development Finance Statistics between 2019 and 2021. Members may update their methodology if needed. To date, the data reflects the following updates: Sweden (2025).

Further information on the reporting rules as well as most members' entire methodologies can be found on the OECD webpage on in-donor refugee costs.

DSD_RIOMRKR@DF_RIOMARKERS.name: RioMarkers: Aid (ODA) activities targeting global environmental objectives
DSD_RIOMRKR@DF_RIOMARKERS.description:
This dataset contains bilateral commitment data on aid in support of environment sustainability and aid to biodiversity, climate change mitigation, climate change adaptation and desertification from the Development Assistance Committee (DAC) Creditor Reporting System (CRS) database.

In their reporting to the DAC CRS, donors are requested to indicate for each activity whether it targets environment and the Rio Conventions (biodiversity, climate change mitigation, climate change adaptation and desertification) or not. A scoring system of three values is used, in which aid activities are marked as targeting environment as the "principal" or "significant" objective, or not at all. For more information on the scoring and criteria, please see here. Please note that the same activity can be marked for several objectives, and therefore caution should be used to avoid double-counting.

For more information on these flows, please see the OECD's main page on official development assistance and finance for sustainable development, including frequently asked questions (FAQs) on ODA. See also the converged statistical reporting directives governing these data, alongside other guidance on using our data.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_HISTORIC.name: Africa's Development Dynamics (AfDD) - full historic data
DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_HISTORIC.description:
The Statistical Annex to the annual Africa's Development Dynamics (AFDD) report is a collection of development indicators that were gathered and analysed while conducting the research that went into the report. These statistics are collected from a variety of reputable international sources and are reported at the national level or for aggregations of relevant country groupings on an annual basis. The Annex includes 39 tables of indicators presenting different development themes.

This table shows all indicators included in all tables in the Statistical Annex, for all years reported. Users can compare time series for different countries, geographic areas, and development indicators selected using the table filters. These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB02.name: Africa's Development Dynamics (AfDD) Table 02 - Annual real GDP growth rate
DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB02.description:
The Statistical Annex to the annual Africa's Development Dynamics (AFDD) report is a collection of development indicators that were gathered and analysed while conducting the research that went into the report. These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

Table 2 shows the full time series of annual real GDP growth, up to present, and including projected real GDP growth rates over the next five years.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB03.description:

These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

Table 3 shows the full time series of annual population growth, up to present, and including projected population growth over the next five years according the medium fertility variant scenario in the World Population Prospects 2022 from the UN Department of Economic and Social Affairs.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB04.description:

These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

Table 4 shows the full time series of annual real GDP growth per capta, up to present, and including projected real GDP growth rates over the next five years calculated using the real GDP growth and population growth figures reported in the AfDD Statistical Annex.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB05.description:

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB08.description:

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB13.description:

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB15.description:

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB16.description:

Table 16 shows data on public finance, including taxes, revenues, expenditure, and debt. Some of these figures are not available at the national level, but only for aggregations of groups of countries.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB17.description:

These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

Table 17 shows data on public finance, including taxes, revenues, expenditure, and debt. Some of these figures are not available at the national level, but only for aggregations of groups of countries.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB18.name: Africa's Development Dynamics (AfDD) Table 18 - Export diversification
DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB18.description:
The Statistical Annex to the annual Africa's Development Dynamics (AFDD) report is a collection of development indicators that were gathered and analysed while conducting the research that went into the report. These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

Table 18 shows indicators of the degree of export diversification, including the five most exported products by year, along with their share of exports. Please click on the metadata buttons by the numbers in order to find the products being referred to. This table also includes the number of export products that amount to 75% and 90% of total exports.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB19.name: Africa's Development Dynamics (AfDD) Table 19 - Global and regional trade
DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB19.description:
The Statistical Annex to the annual Africa's Development Dynamics (AFDD) report is a collection of development indicators that were gathered and analysed while conducting the research that went into the report. These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

Table 19 shows indicators of the importance of global and regional trade in national imports and exports. Indicators include percentage of total imports and exports to and from China, the USA, and the EU, within the same continent, and the same region as well as the share of intra- and inter-continental trade which are intermediate goods.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB20.description:
The Statistical Annex to the annual Africa's Development Dynamics (AFDD) report is a collection of development indicators that were gathered and analysed while conducting the research that went into the report. These data are also available online for free viewing or download at https://oe.cd/AFDD-2024, a bilingual website which links to the electronic version of the Africa's Development Dynamics book in both English and French.

Table 20 shows indicators of external financial flows in US dollars and as a percentage of GDP, including foreign direct investment, portfolio investment, net official development assistance, and remittances.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB21.description:

Table 21 shows indicators of investment flows and capital stocks, in US dollars and as a percentage of GDP, including general government investment, public-private partnerships, and private investment.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB22.name: Africa's Development Dynamics (AfDD) Table 22 - Returns on direct investments
DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB22.description:

Table 22 shows indicators of returns on direct investments, as a percentage of GDP and in US dollars. Includes investment liabilities, debit, assets, and credit, and returns on inward and outward flows of investments.

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB23.description:
The Statistical Annex to the annual Africa's Development Dynamics (AFDD) report is a collection of development indicators that were gathered and analysed while conducting the research that went into the report. DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB25.description:

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB26.description:

DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB27.name: Africa's Development Dynamics (AfDD) Table 27 - Origin and destination of added value
DSD_AFDD_STAT_ANNEX@DF_TAB27.description:

Table 27 shows statistics on the origin and destination of added value, whether it is domestic, in neighbouring countries, within the same continent, or outside the continent. This is an indication of the degree to which national economies participate in regional and global value chains.

Table 29 shows estimates of total national wealth, taking into account produced capital, human capital, and natural resources. These estimates were calculated in the World Bank publication The Changing Wealth of Nations 2021.

DSD_GID@DF_GID_2023.name: Gender, Institutions and Development Database (GID-DB) 2023
DSD_GID@DF_GID_2023.description:
The Gender Institutions and Development Database (GID-DB) provides policy makers, researchers and the public in general with key data on gender-based discrimination in social institutions. Data help analyse women's empowerment and understand gender gaps in key areas of development.

The GID-DB is produced on a regular basis, alongside the Social Institutions and Gender Index. Data from previous editions can be accessed for the following years: 2019, 2014, 2012 and 2009. The GID-DB 2023 covers 179 countries and territories and contains comprehensive information on legal, cultural and traditional practices that discriminate against women and girls.

DSD_SIGI@DF_SIGI_2023.name: Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) 2023
DSD_SIGI@DF_SIGI_2023.description:
The Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) is a composite index measuring discriminatory social institutions. The SIGI is produced on a regular basis and data from previous editions can be accessed for the following years: 2019, 2014, 2012 and 2009.

The SIGI 2023 builds on 25 variables measuring discrimination in social institutions that can be accessed in the GID-DB 2023, and which are grouped into four dimensions: discrimination in the family, restricted physical integrity, restricted access to productive and financial resources, and restricted civil liberties. The SIGI 2023 seeks to provide an in-depth and global look at how laws, attitudes and practices create gaps between women and men in terms of opportunities and outcomes.

The SIGI and its dimensions range from 0 to 100, with 0 indicating no discrimination and 100 indicating absolute discrimination against women.

The SIGI 2023 covers 179 countries, but due to data gaps in one or more of the 25 variables used to compute the index, SIGI scores could only be calculated for 140 countries and territories.

Additionally, the SIGI framework can be used to conduct country studies in order to assess gender-based discrimination at the sub-national level. Recent SIGI country studies include Côte d’Ivoire and Tanzania.

DSD_PMR@DF_PMR.name: Product market regulation
DSD_PMR@DF_PMR.description: Competition and pro-competition regulations are vital to foster innovation, business dynamism, productivity, investment, and employment. For 25 years, the OECD Product Market Regulation (PMR) indicators have been the leading metric of pro-competitive regulatory settings. These indicators assess the alignment of a country’s regulatory framework with international best practices, measuring both economy-wide and sector-specific regulatory barriers to entry and competition.

DSD_PMR@DF_PMR_WBG.name: Product market regulation OECD-WBG (World Bank Group)
DSD_PMR@DF_PMR_WBG.description: Competition and pro-competition regulations are vital to foster innovation, business dynamism, productivity, investment, and employment. For 25 years, the OECD Product Market Regulation (PMR) indicators have been the leading metric of pro-competitive regulatory settings. These indicators assess the alignment of a country’s regulatory framework with international best practices, measuring both economy-wide and sector-specific regulatory barriers to entry and competition. The countries covered in the OECD-WBG PMR database have been done in collaboration with the World Bank Group

DSD_CPU@DF_CPU.name: Climate Policy Uncertainty
DSD_CPU@DF_CPU.description:
The CPU database proposes a new indicator of Climate Policy Uncertainty (CPU) based on newspaper coverage frequency. The indicator spikes near major political events and during major discussions around potentially significant climate policy changes. Using a global firm-level dataset, the empirical analysis shows that Climate Policy Uncertainty is associated with economically and statistically significant decreases in investment, particularly in pollution-intensive sectors that are most exposed to climate policies, and among capital intensive companies.
More information : Berestycki, C., et al. (2022), "Measuring and assessing the effects of climate policy uncertainty", OECD Economics Department Working Papers, No. 1724, OECD Publishing, Paris. .
https://doi.org/10.1787/34483d83-en .
Contact : eco.contact@oecd.org

DSD_EO@DF_EO.name: Economic Outlook 117
DSD_EO@DF_EO.description:
The OECD Economic Outlook presents the OECD’s analysis of the major global economic trends and prospects for the next two years. The Outlook puts forward a consistent set of projections for output, employment, government spending, prices and current balances based on a review of each member country and of the induced effect on each of them on international developments.
OECD (2025), OECD Economic Outlook No 117 (Edition 2025/1)
  • EO117 Database documentation
  • EO117 Last historical points

DSD_EO_LTB@DF_EO_LTB.name: OECD Economic Outlook 117 long-term scenarios
DSD_EO_LTB@DF_EO_LTB.description: Long-run economic scenarios (to 2100) are produced every 2-3 years to look at factors influencing the global economy that play out over many decades. Different vintages look at a different set of scenarios described in an associated publication. Selected series from these scenarios are available here for individual OECD, accession and G20 economies. A breakdown of the global economy by regions (following World Bank definitions) is also provided.

DSD_EPS@DF_EPS.name: OECD Environmental Policy Stringency Index
DSD_EPS@DF_EPS.description: The OECD Environmental Policy Stringency Index (EPS) is a country-specific and internationally comparable measure of the stringency of environmental policy ranging from zero (least stringent) to six (most stringent). The index covers the years from 1990 to 2020, across 40 countries and 13 policy instruments, focusing on climate change and air pollution mitigation policies. The structure of the EPS, its components and the index construction can be accessed in the related 2022 OECD working paper: https://doi.org/10.1787/90ab82e8-en . This paper updates the 2014 working paper and index: https://doi.org/10.1787/5jxrjnc45gvg-en .

DSD_AN_HOUSE_PRICES@DF_HOUSE_PRICES.name: Analytical house prices indicators
DSD_AN_HOUSE_PRICES@DF_HOUSE_PRICES.description:
Residential Property Prices Indices (RPPIs) – also named House price indices (HPIs), are index numbers that measure the prices of residential properties over time. RPPIs are key statistics not only for citizens and households across the world, but also for economic and monetary policy makers. They can help, for example, to monitor potential macroeconomic imbalances and the risk exposure of the household and financial sectors.

This dataset covers the OECD member countries and some non-member countries. In addition to the nominal RPPIs it contains information on real house prices, rental prices, and the ratios of nominal prices to rents and to disposable household income per capita. This dataset contains quarterly and annual statistics for each country. Annual figures refer to the average of the year.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_AGE.name: Instruction time in compulsory general education by age
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_AGE.description:
This dataset presents the number of hours of statutory instruction time in full-time compulsory education by age. It covers all ages in primary, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ALL.name: Student instruction time - full dataset
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the students' instruction time in compulsory general education.

It covers primary education, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ISCED.name: Instruction time in compulsory general education
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ISCED.description:
This dataset presents the number of hours of statutory instruction time in full-time compulsory education. It covers primary education, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ISCED_REG.name: Instruction time in compulsory general education - Subnational entities
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ISCED_REG.description:
This dataset presents the number of hours of statutory instruction time in full-time compulsory education for some subnational entities. It covers primary education, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ORG.name: Organisation of compulsory general education
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ORG.description:
This dataset presents how full-time compulsory education is organised, such as number of grades. It covers primary education, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ORG_REG.name: Organisation of compulsory general education - Subnational entities
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_ORG_REG.description:
This dataset presents how full-time compulsory education is organised, such as number of grades, for some subnational entities. It covers primary education, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_SUBJ_AGE.name: Instruction time per subject by age
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_SUBJ_AGE.description:
This dataset presents the percentage of total compulsory instruction time spent on different subjects by age. It covers primary education, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_SUBJ_ISCED.name: Instruction time per subject by level of education
DSD_EAG_IT@DF_EAG_IT_SUBJ_ISCED.description:
This dataset presents the percentage of total compulsory instruction time spent on different subjects by level of education. It covers primary education, lower secondary general education and compulsory upper secondary general education, but excludes pre-primary education, even if compulsory. Data refers to the reference year 2025 (school year 2024/25 or 2025), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_DISTR_MEDIAN.name: Earners distribution based on their level of earnings relative to the overall median, by age group, gender and educational attainment level
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_DISTR_MEDIAN.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of workers based on their level of earnings relative to the overall median, by educational attainment level, gender and age group. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the distribution of 25-64 year-old workers, for a given level of the three aggregated levels of educational attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by gender and by age group. Overall median refers the median earnings from work for 25-64 year-olds with income from employment (full- and part-time workers) for all levels of educational attainment. Data refer to gross earnings except for Argentina and Türkiye. Filter the time period to visualise historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_FIELD.name: Earnings differences by field of study among tertiary-educated workers, by age group, gender and level of tertiary educational attainment
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_FIELD.description:
This dataset contains data on the differrences in earnings from employment by field of study, age group, educational attainment level and work time arrangement. The baseline is the earnings of tertiary-educated full-time workers from all fields of study. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year). The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, age group, gender and by work time arrangement (e.g. full- or part-time employment).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_BEL.name: Earnings of workers relative to the earnings of workers with below upper secondary educational attainment, by age group, gender and educational attainment level
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_BEL.description:
This dataset contains data on the relative earnings of workers, by age group, gender, educational attainment level and work time arrangement. The baseline is the earnings of workers with below upper secondary attainment, and it is primarily served to analyse the earnings difference by programme orientation. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the earnings of 25-34 year-old full-time workers with general or vocational upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary attainment, or bachelor's or equivalent degree as a percentage of the earnings of their peers with below upper secondary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by gender, by level of educational attainment, by age group and by work time arrangement (e.g. full- or part-time employment). Data refer to gross earnings except for Argentina and Türkiye. Data on full-time workers are recommended because of better comparability. Filter the time period to visualise historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_MALE.name: Earnings differences by gender, by age group and educational attainment level
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_MALE.description:
This dataset contains data on the gender differrences in earnings from employment, by age group, educational attainment level and work time arrangement. The baseline is men's earnings. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the earnings of 25-64 year-old full-time female workers as a percentage of the earnings of their male counterparts, by the three aggregated levels of educational attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by educational attainment, by age group and by work time arrangement (e.g. full- or part-time employment).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_NATIVE.name: Earnings differences by country of birth and age at migration, by age group, gender and educational attainment level
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_NATIVE.description:
This dataset contains data on the differrences in earnings from employment between native- and foreign-born adults, by age group, gender, educational attainment level and work time arrangement. The baseline is the earnings of native-born workers. The default table displays 2022 data (or the latest available year) on the earnings of 25-64 year-old native-born full-time workers as a percentage of the earnings of their foreign-born counterparts, by the three aggregated levels of educational attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by educational attainment level, age group, gender, age at migration and by work time arrangement (e.g. full- or part-time employment).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_UPPER.name: Earnings of workers relative to the earnings of workers with upper secondary educational attainment, by age group, gender and educational attainment level
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_UPPER.description:
This dataset contains data on the relative earnings of workers, by age group, gender, educational attainment level and work time arrangement. The baseline is the earnings of workers with upper secondary attainment. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the earnings of 25-64 year-old full-time workers with below upper secondary attainment or teritary attainment as a percentage of the earnings of their peers with upper secondary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by gender, educational attainment level, age group and work time arrangement (e.g. full- or part-time employment). Note that the baseline is the earnings of workers with upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary attainment for Colombia, France, Italy, Peru and Swizterland. Data refer to gross earnings except for Argentina and Türkiye. Data on full-time workers are recommended because of better comparability. Filter the time period to visualise historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_YAD.name: Earnings of workers relative to the earnings of 25-34 year-olds, by age group, gender and educational attainment level
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_EARN_REL_YAD.description:
This dataset contains data on the relative earnings of workers, by age group, gender, educational attainment level and work time arrangement. The baseline is the earnings of 25-34 year-old workers. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the earnings of 35-44, 45-54 and 55-64 year-old full-time workers as a percentage of the earnings of their 25-34 year-old peers, by the three aggregated levels of educational attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by gender, by educational attainment level, by age group and by work time arrangement (e.g. full- or part-time employment).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_ALL.name: National Educational Attainment Classification (NEAC) and labour market status (full dataset)

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_DURUNEM.name: Duration of unemployment distribution among unemployed adults, by educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_DURUNEM.description:
This dataset contains data on the duration of unemployment distribution among unemployed adults, by educational attainment, age group and gender. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the distribution of unemployed 25-64 year-olds by duration of unemployment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_EA.name: Adults' educational attainment distribution, by age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_EA.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of adults with a given age group and gender by educational attainment level. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the distribution of 25-64 year-olds by educational attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by programme orientation, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_EA_FIEL.name: Field of study distribution of tertiary-educated adults, by level of tertiary educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_EA_FIEL.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of tertiary-educated adults with a given age group and gender by field of study. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the distribution of tertiary-educated 25-64 year-olds by field of study. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_EA_MIGR.name: Adults' educational attainment distribution, by country of birth, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_EA_MIGR.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of native- and foreign-born adults with a given age group and gender by educational attainment level. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the distribution of native- and foreign-born 25-64 year-olds by educational attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by age at migration, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_GENDER.name: Adults' gender distribution, by educational attainment level and age group
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_GENDER.description:
This dataset contains data on the gender distribution of adults with a given age group and educational attainment level. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the gender distribution of 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by educational attainment, by programme orientation and by age group. Filter the time period to visualise historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_MIGR.name: Adults' migration status distribution, by educational attainment level, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_DISTR_MIGR.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of adults with a given age group, gender, educational attainment level and migration status. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the share of native- and foreign-born 25-64 year-olds with a given level of educational attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by age at migration, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_EMP.name: Employment rates of adults, by educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_EMP.description:
This dataset contains data on employment rates by educational attainment level, age group and gender. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the employment rates of 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_EMP_FIELD.name: Employment rates of tertiary-educated adults, by field of study, tertiary educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_EMP_FIELD.description:

The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the employment rates of all tertiary-educated 25-64 year-olds. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by filed of study, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_EMP_MIGR.name: Employment rates of adults, by educational attainment, age group, gender, country of birth and age at migration
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_EMP_MIGR.description:

The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the employment rates of native- and foreign-born 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by age at migration, by gender and by age group. For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_INAC.description:

The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the inactivity rates of 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_INAC_FIELD.name: Inactivity rates of tertiary-educated adults, by field of study, tertiary educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_INAC_FIELD.description:

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_INAC_MIGR.name: Inactivity rates of adults, by educational attainment, age group, gender, country of birth and age at migration
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_INAC_MIGR.description:
This dataset contains data on inactivity rates by educational attainment level, migration status, age group and gender. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the inactivity rates of native- and foreign-born 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by age at migration, by gender and by age group. For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_LF.name: Labour force participation rates of adults, by educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_LF.description:
This dataset contains data on labour force participation rates by educational attainment level, age group and gender. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the labour force participation rates of 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMP.name: Unemployment rates of adults, by educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMP.description:
This dataset contains data on unemployment rates by educational attainment level, age group and gender. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the unemployment rates of 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMPLOYED.name: Share of unemployed adults among all adults, by educational attainment level, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMPLOYED.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of unemployed adults by educational attainment level, age group and gender. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the share of 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment who are unemployed among all 25-64 year-olds. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to visualise historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMP_FIELD.name: Unemployment rates of tertiary-educated adults, by field of study, tertiary educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMP_FIELD.description:
This dataset contains data on unemployment rates of tertiary-educated adults by educational attainment level, field of study, age group and gender. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the unemployment rates of all tertiary-educated 25-64 year-olds. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by filed of study, by gender and by age group. Filter the time period to display historical data.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMP_MIGR.name: Unemployment rates of adults, by educational attainment, age group, gender, country of birth and age at migration
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_NEAC_UNEMP_MIGR.description:
This dataset contains data on unemployment rates by educational attainment level, migration status, age group and gender. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on the unemployment rates of native- and foreign-born 25-64 year-olds with below upper secondary, upper secondary or post-secondary non-tertiary, or tertiary attainment. The selection can be changed to display data by more detailed educational attainment level, by programme orientation, by age at migration, by gender and by age group.
