For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_TRANS.name: Distribution of young adults' education and work status, for a given level of educational attainment, age group and gender
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_TRANS.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of young adults by education and work status. The default table displays 2024 data (or the latest available year) on the distribution of 18-24 year-olds in education/not in education, by their work status (e.g. employed or not employed). Young adults who are neither employed nor in formal education and training are also called NEET. The selection can be changed to display data by educational attainment, by detailed education and work status and by age group.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_TRANS_ALL.name: Youth's transition from education to work (TRANS) (full dataset)

DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_TRANS_MIGR.name: Share of young adults who are not employment nor in formal education or training (NEET), by country of birth and age at migration
DSD_EAG_LSO_EA@DF_LSO_TRANS_MIGR.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of young adults who are native- and foreign-born, by education and work status. The default table displays 2023 data (or the latest available year) on share of native- and foreign-born 15-29 year-olds, who are neither employed nor in formal education and training (e.g. NEET). The selection can be changed to display data by educational attainment, by education and work status, by age group and by age at migration.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_ALL.name: Actual salaries of teachers and school heads - full dataset
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the actual salaries of teachers and school heads.

It covers teachers and school heads working full time in public institutions, working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. The default selection shows all available measures of the OECD average.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_ALL.name: Actual salary of teachers and school heads - full dataset
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the actual salaries of teachers and school heads.

It covers teachers and school heads working full time in public institutions, working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_SCH.name: School heads' actual salary
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_SCH.description:
This dataset presents data on actual salaries of school heads (including additional work-related payments). It covers school heads aged 25-64, working full time in public institutions, and working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_SCH_REG.name: School heads' actual salary (subnational data)
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_SCH_REG.description:
This dataset presents data on actual salaries of school heads (including additional work-related payments) for some subnational entities. It covers school heads aged 25-64, working full time in public institutions, and working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_SCH_REL.name: School heads' actual salary relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_SCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares actual salaries of school heads (including additional work-related payments) with earnings of tertiary-educated workers. It covers school heads aged 25-64, working full time in public institutions, and working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_TCH.name: Teachers' actual salary
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_TCH.description:
This dataset presents data on actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments). It covers teachers aged 25-64, working full time in public institutions, and teaching in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_TCH_REG.name: Teachers' actual salary (subnational data)
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_TCH_REG.description:
This dataset presents data on actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments) for some subnational entities. It covers teachers aged 25-64, working full time in public institutions, and teaching in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_TCH_REL.name: Teachers' actual salary relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_EAG_SAL_ACT_TCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments) with earnings of tertiary-educated workers. It covers teachers aged 25-64, working full time in public institutions, and teaching in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_SCH.name: School heads' actual salaries
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_SCH.description:
This dataset contains data on actual salaries of school heads (including additional work-related payments). It covers full-time school heads in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD for school heads aged 25-64. The selection can be changed to display data by age group, by gender (for teachers aged 25-64 only), and by currency unit (equivalent USD or national currency)

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_SCH_REG.name: School heads' actual salaries - Subnational entities
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_SCH_REG.description:
This dataset contains data on actual salaries of school heads (including additional work-related payments) in subnational entities of some countries. It covers full-time school heads in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD for school heads aged 25-64. The selection can be changed to display data in national currency.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_SCH_REL.name: School heads' actual salaries relative to workers' earnings
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_SCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares actual salaries of school heads (including additional work-related payments) with earnings of tertiary-educated workers. It covers full-time school heads in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data for school heads aged 25-64. The default table displays data on actual salaries relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers. The selection can be changed to display data by age group or by gender (for teachers aged 25-64 only).

The selection can also be changed to display data on actual salaries of teachers relative to earnings of similarly-educated workers.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_TCH.name: Teachers' actual salaries
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_TCH.description:
This dataset contains data on actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments). It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD for teachers aged 25-64. The selection can be changed to display data by age group, by gender (for teachers aged 25-64 only), and by currency unit (equivalent USD or national currency).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

For historical data, see Trends in teachers’ actual salaries since 2000.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_TCH_REG.name: Teachers' actual salaries - Subnational entities
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_TCH_REG.description:
This dataset contains data on actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments) in subnational entities of some countries. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD for teachers aged 25-64. The selection can be changed to display data by age group, by gender (for teachers aged 25-64 only), and by currency unit (equivalent USD or national currency)

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_TCH_REL.name: Teachers' actual salaries relative to workers' earnings
DSD_EAG_SAL_ACT@DF_TCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments) with earnings of workers. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. The default table displays data for teachers aged 25-64.

The default table displays data on actual salaries of teachers relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers. The selection can be changed to display data by age group or by gender (for teachers aged 25-64 only).

The selection can also be changed to display data on actual salaries of teachers relative to earnings of similarly-educated workers.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_ALL.name: Statutory salaries of teachers and school heads - full dataset
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the statutory salaries of teachers and school heads.

It covers teachers and school heads working full time in public institutions, working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. The default selection shows all available measures of the OECD average.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_ALL.name: Statutory salary of teachers and school heads - full dataset
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the statutory salaries of teachers and school heads.

It covers teachers and school heads working full time in public institutions, working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_SCH.name: School heads' statutory salary
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_SCH.description:
This dataset presents data on statutory salaries of school heads. It covers school heads working full time in public institutions, in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_SCH_REL.name: School heads' statutory salary relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_SCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares statutory salaries of school heads with earnings of tertiary-educated workers. It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, teaching pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH.name: Teachers' statutory salary
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH.description:
This dataset presents data on statutory salaries of teachers at different points of their careers. It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, teaching pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH_COM.name: Comparison of teachers' statutory salary
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH_COM.description:
This dataset presents comparative indicators on statutory salaries of teachers. It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, teaching pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH_REG.name: Teachers' statutory salary (subnational data)
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH_REG.description:
This dataset presents data on statutory salaries of teachers at different points of their careers for some subnational entities. It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, teaching pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH_REL.name: Teachers' statutory salary relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_EAG_SAL_STA_TCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares statutory salaries of teachers with earnings of tertiary-educated workers. It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, teaching pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data refers to the reference year 2022 (school year 2021/22 or 2022), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_SCH.name: School heads' statutory salaries
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_SCH.description:
This dataset contains data on statutory salaries of school heads. It covers full-time school heads with the minimum qualification, working in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD. The selection can be changed by currency unit (equivalent USD or national currency).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_SCH_REL.name: School heads' statutory salaries relative to workers' earnings
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_SCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares statutory salaries of school heads with earnings of tertiary-educated workers. It covers full-time school heads with the minimum qualification, working in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The table displays data on statutory salaries of school heads relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH.name: Teachers' statutory salaries
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH.description:
This dataset contains data on statutory salaries of teachers at different points of their careers (starting salary, salaries after 10 and 15 years of experience, and salary at the top of the salary scale). It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD for teachers with the most prevalent qualification at each stage of career (in the reference year). The selection can be changed to display data by qualification level of teachers (minimum, most prevalent or maximum) and by currency unit (equivalent USD or national currency).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

For historical data, see Trends in teachers’ statutory salaries since 2000.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_CHG.name: Change in teachers' statutory salaries over the career
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_CHG.description:
This dataset contains indicators to change in statutory salaries of teachers over the career. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data the ratio of salary at the top of scale to salary at the start of the career and on the years to reach salary at the top of scale with the most prevalent qualification to enter the profession. The selection can be changed to display data by qualification level of teachers (minimum qualification to enter the profession or the most prevalent to enter the profession).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_COM.name: Comparative indicators on teachers' statutory salaries
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_COM.description:
This dataset contains comparative indicators on statutory salaries of teachers. It covers full-time teachers with the most prevalent qualification after 15 years of experience, in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD on statutory salary per hour of net teaching time for teachers and the ratio of this indicator between primary and upper secondary general education.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2024. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2024 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_REG.name: Teachers' statutory salaries - Subnational entities
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_REG.description:
This dataset contains data on statutory salaries of teachers with the most prevalent qualification at different points of their careers in subnational entities of some countries. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data in equivalent USD for teachers at each stage of career. The selection can be changed by currency unit (equivalent USD or national currency).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_REL.name: Teachers' statutory salaries relative to workers' earnings
DSD_EAG_SAL_STA@DF_TCH_REL.description:
This dataset compares statutory salaries of teachers with earnings of workers. It covers full-time teachers, in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays data on statutory salaries of teachers (with the most prevalent qualification after 15 years of experience) relative to earnings of tertiary-educated workers. The selection can be changed to display data by qualification level of teachers (the most prevalent qualification to enter the profession or the most prevalent qualification after 15 years of experience), by experience level (only for the most prevalent qualification to enter the profession) and by comparison group (tertiary-educated workers or similarly educated workers).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_ALL.name: Trends in teachers' salaries - full dataset
DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on salaries of teachers since 2000. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. The default selection shows all available measures of the OECD averages.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_EAG_SAL_TREND_ACT.name: Trends in teachers’ actual salary since 2000
DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_EAG_SAL_TREND_ACT.description:
This dataset presents a trend of actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments) since 2000. It covers teachers aged 25-64, working full time in public institutions, and teaching in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_EAG_SAL_TREND_ALL.name: Trends in teachers' salary - full dataset
DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_EAG_SAL_TREND_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the trend data for salaries of teachers.

It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data is available from the reference year 2000.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_EAG_SAL_TREND_STA.name: Trends in teachers’ statutory salary since 2000
DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_EAG_SAL_TREND_STA.description:
This dataset presents a trend of statutory salaries of teachers since 2000. It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, teaching in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_TCH_ACT.name: Trends in teachers’ actual salaries since 2000
DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_TCH_ACT.description:
This dataset contains a trend of actual salaries of teachers (including additional work-related payments) since 2000. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays index of change in actual salaries of teachers in primary education aged 25-64. The selection can be changed to display data by education level, and data in national currency.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_TCH_STA.name: Trends in teachers’ statutory salaries since 2000
DSD_EAG_SAL_TREND@DF_TCH_STA.description:
This dataset contains a trend of statutory salaries of teachers since 2000. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education.

The default table displays index of change in statutory salaries of teachers in primary education after 15 years of experience with the most prevalent qualification at this stage of the career. The selection can be changed to display data by education level and by qualification level, and data in national currency.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2025. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2025 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_SUBNAT_UOE_FIN@DF_SUBNAT_UOE_FIN.name: Subnational total expenditure on educational institutions per full-time equivalent student
DSD_EAG_SUBNAT_UOE_FIN@DF_SUBNAT_UOE_FIN.description:
This dataset contains subnational data on expenditure per full-time equivalent student. The default table displays data for lastest data collection reference year in current USD PPP, from all expenditure sources. The selection can be changed to display data by year. Please note that the filters are inter related, meaning that selection in one category may impact the possibility to select options in another category.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_INDIC_SHARE_E.name: Share of total government expenditure on education
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_INDIC_SHARE_E.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of total government expenditure devoted to education. The default table displays the total government expenditure on education as a share of the total government expenditure on all services by level of education. Please note that the filters are inter related, meaning that selection in one category may impact the possibility to select options in another category.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_INDIC_SOURCE_.name: Full dataset - Indicators, source, destination and nature of expenditure on education
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_INDIC_SOURCE_.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. A default selection shows government expenditure on educational institutions simply to accelerate the display and loading of the data.

The dataset contains all indicators as well as the full raw data on the source, destination and nature of expenditure on education in local currency and in USD PPP, in constant and current prices.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_NATURE.name: Allocation of expenditure (from all sources) - full dataset
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_NATURE.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the allocation of expenditure in local currency and in USD PPP, in constant and current prices. There is no filter nor default view for this dataset, browsing the data may therefore be slow.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources, and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_NATURE_CUR_CA.name: Capital and total current expenditure on education (from all sources)
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_NATURE_CUR_CA.description:
This dataset contains data on capital and current expenditure on education. The default table displays data in 2020 constant USD PPP, for the combined primary to tertiary levels of education, and for both public and private educational institutions combined. This can be changed to display data by: level of education, type of educational institution, local currency/USD PPP, and current/constant prices. Please note that the filters are inter related, meaning that selection in one category may impact the possibility to select options in another category.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_NATURE_STAFF.name: Expenditure on staff compensation in educational institutions (from all sources)
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_NATURE_STAFF.description:
This dataset contains data on staff compensation in educational institutions. The default table displays information on expenditure for salaries, pensions and other non-salary benefits in 2020 constant USD PPP, for the combined primary to tertiary levels of education, for public and government dependent private institutions. This can be changed to display data by: level of education, type of institution, type of expenditure, local currency/USD PPP, and current/constant prices. Please note that the filters are inter related, meaning that selection in one category may impact the possibility to select options in another category.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_SOURCE.name: Source and destination of expenditure - full dataset
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_SOURCE.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the source and destination of expenditure in local currency and in USD PPP, in constant and current prices. There is no filter nor default view for this dataset, browsing the data may therefore be slow.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources, and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_SOURCE_GV_PR_.name: Distribution of government, private and non-domestic expenditure on educational institutions
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_FIN_SOURCE_GV_PR_.description:
This dataset contains data on government, private and expenditure on educational institutions. Government expenditure can be brokendown by central, regional (state) and local levels of government. Private sector can also be brokendown by households and other non-educational private sector. Expenditure are reported after transfers between entities, transfers can be from higher to lower levels of government, from the government to the private sector, or from non-domestic source to the government. The default table displays expenditure for the general government, the private sector and non-domestic sources in 2020 constant USD PPP (top section), in percentage of GDP (middle section), and in percentage (distribution by sector, in the bottom section), for the combined primary to tertiary levels of education, and for all public and private educational institutions. This can be changed to display data by: level of education, type of educational institution, level of financing source, local currency/USD PPP, and current/constant prices. Please note that the filters are inter related, meaning that selection in one category may impact the possibility to select options in another category.

Please note that non-domestic expenditure is labelled "Rest of the world".

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_INDIC_FIN_GDP.name: Expenditure on educational institutions as a percentage of GDP
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_INDIC_FIN_GDP.description:
This dataset contains data on expenditure on educational institutions as a percentage of GDP. The default table displays expenditure for the general government, the private sector and non-domestic sources, for the combined primary to tertiary levels of education, and for all public and private educational institutions. This can be changed to display data by: level of education, and type of educational institution.

Please note that non-domestic expenditure is labelled "Rest of the world".

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2023. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources, and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2023 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_INDIC_FIN_PERSTUD.name: Expenditure on educational institutions per full-time equivalent student
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN@DF_UOE_INDIC_FIN_PERSTUD.description:
This dataset contains data on expenditure per full-time equivalent student and per full-time equivalent student as a percentage of GPD per capita. The default table displays data for lastest data collection reference year in current USD PPP and as a percentage of GDP per capita, from all expenditure sources, and unfiltered by type of expenditure. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, by source of expenditure, by destination of expenditure and by type of expenditure. Please note that the filters are inter related, meaning that selection in one category may impact the possibility to select options in another category.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN_ANNEX@DF_UOE_FIN_ANNEX.name: Reference statistics for education finance indicators
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN_ANNEX@DF_UOE_FIN_ANNEX.description:
This dataset contains reference statistics that are used in the calculation of education expenditure data. This dataset includes information on Gross domestic product (GDP), GDP per capita, GDP adjusted to the education finance data, on Purchasing Power Parities for GDP, on GDP deflator, on population, and on government expenditure on all services.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN_ENR@DF_UOE_FIN_ENR.name: Enrolment data adjusted to the financial year
DSD_EAG_UOE_FIN_ENR@DF_UOE_FIN_ENR.description:
This dataset contains data on enrolment data adjusted to the financial year. This information is only used to calculate the expenditure per student and is provided as a reference statistics. It should NOT be used as the official enrolment figures.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Share of teachers by age range
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of classroom teachers (ISCED 0-4) and academic staff (ISCED 5-8) by age range. The default table displays data for the latest available year and a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, other levels of education and sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Average class size
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the average class size by type of institution. The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data by year.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Number of classroom teachers and academic staff by age
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of classroom teachers (ISCED 0-4) and academic staff (ISCED 5-8) by age. The default table displays data for the latest available year and for a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, other levels of education and sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Number of classroom teachers and academic staffs by type of institution
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of classroom teachers (ISCED 0-4) and academic staff (ISCED 5-8) by type of institution. The default table displays data for the latest available year and a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, other levels of education, intensity and sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Number of teacher aides
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of teacher aides (ISCED 0-3). The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year and sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Share of teachers by gender and age range
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of classroom teachers (ISCED 0-4) and academic staff (ISCED 5-8) by gender and age range. The default table displays data for the latest available year, for women and for a subset of education levels and age groups. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, other levels of education/age groups and men.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Ratio of students to teaching staff by type of institution
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the ratio of students to classroom teachers (ISCED 0-4) or academic staff (ISCED 5-8) by type of institution. The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data by year.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.name: Number of students adjusted to classroom teachers and academic staffs by type of institution
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_PERS@DF_UOE_NF_PERS_.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of students adjusted to classroom teachers and academic staffs by type of institution. The default table displays 2022 data. The selection can be changed to display data by year.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_DIST_.name: Distribution of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates by field of education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_DIST_.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates by field of education. The default table displays graduates data for the latest available year and for the main fields of education and tertiary levels of education. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, other education levels, subset of fields of education, mobility status, sex and measure (students enrolled, new entrants).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_DIST_.name: Repetition rate by level of education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_DIST_.description:
This dataset contains data on the repetition rate by level of education. The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data by year.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_DIST_.name: Distribution of students in vocational education and training programmes by level of education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_DIST_.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of students in vocational education and training programmes by level of education. The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year and by sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_ENRL_.name: Enrolment rate by age
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_ENRL_.description:
This dataset contains data on enrolment rate by age. The default table displays data for all levels of education, for the the latest available year and for a subset of age groups. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, sex and other age groups.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_MEAN_.name: Mean age of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_MEAN_.description:
This dataset contains data on mean age of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates. The default table displays graduates and new entrants data for the latest available year and for diferent tertiary levels of education. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, other levels of education, sex, mobility status and measure (enrolments).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_NAT_M.name: Share of national tertiary students enrolled abroad
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_NAT_M.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of national students going abroad.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_NR_NA.name: Number of national tertiary students enrolled abroad
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_NR_NA.description:
This dataset contains data on the total number of mobile national students abroad.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_A.name: Number of enrolled adults by age and level of education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_A.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of enrolled adults by age and level of education. The default table displays data for the latest available year and all men and women. The selection can be changed to display data: by year and by sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_A.name: Number of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates by age
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_A.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates by age. The default table displays data on enrolled students in Australia for the latest available year and for a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, reference area, mobility status, sex, age and measure (graduates, new entrants).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_F.name: Number of enrolled students, graduates and new entrants by field of education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_F.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates by field of education. The default table displays graduates data for the latest available year, for the main fields of education and tertiary levels of education. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, other education levels, subset of fields of education, mobility status, sex and measure (students enrolled, new entrants).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_I.name: Number of enrolled students and graduates by type of institution
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_I.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of enrolled students and graduates by type of institution. The default table displays data on enrolled students for the latest available year and for a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, by intensity, by sex and measure (graduates).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_M.name: Number of mobile students enrolled and graduated by country of origin
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_M.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of mobile students enrolled and graduated by country of origin. The default table displays data on enrolled students in Australia for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, reference area, sex and measure (graduates).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_R.name: Number of students and repeaters by grade and level of education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_RAW_R.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of students (initial education only) and repeaters by grade and level of education. The default table displays data for the latest available year and for all ages. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, by age (only for the number of students by grade) and sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of new entrants and graduates in each field of education by gender
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of new entrants and graduates in each field of education by gender. The default table displays tertiary graduates data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, specific education levels, mobility status, sex and measure (new entrants).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of new entrants to and first-time graduates at tertiary education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of new entrants to and first-time graduates at tertiary education. The default table displays tertiary new entrants and graduates data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, sex and mobility status. Data correspond to the concept of first-time tertiary, i.e. person who has enter (new entrants) or successfully completed (graduates) an education programme at the tertiary level for the first time. The student may have entered / completed the programme at either ISCED level 5 (short-cyle tertiary) , 6 (bachelor) or 7 (master long first degree).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates by gender
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates by gender. The default table displays graduates data for the latest available year and for a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, mobility status, sex and measure (enrolled students, new entrants).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Distribution of enrolled students and graduates by type of institution
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the distribution of enrolled students and graduates by type of institution. The default table displays data on enrolled students the latest available year and for a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, by intensity, by sex and measure (graduates).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of mobile enrolments, new entrants and graduates
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of mobile new entrants and graduates by tertiary levels. The default table displays tertiary graduates data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, sex and measure (new entrants). Data for short-cyle tertiary, bachelor's, master's combined correspond to the concept of first-time tertiary, i.e. person who has enter (new entrants) or successfully completed (graduates) an education programme at the tertiary level for the first time. The student may have entered / completed the programme at either ISCED level 5 (short-cyle tertiary) , 6 (bachelor) or 7 (master long first degree).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of mobile students enrolled at tertiary level by country of destination
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of mobile students by country of destination. The default table displays data by region of destination the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year and by country of destination.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of mobile students enrolled at tertiary level by country of origin
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of mobile students by country of origin. The default table displays data by region of origin for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year and by country of origin.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of enrolled part-time and full-time students
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of enrolled part-time and full-time students. The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year and by sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of repeaters by gender and level of education
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of repeaters by gender and level of education. The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data by year.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.name: Share of students enrolled in school and work-based programmes
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_SHARE.description:
This dataset contains data on the share of students enrolled in school and work-based programmes. The default table displays data for the latest available year. The selection can be changed to display data: by year and by sex.

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_STUD_.name: Total number of enrolled students, new entrants and graduates
DSD_EAG_UOE_NON_FIN_STUD@DF_UOE_NF_STUD_.description:
This dataset contains data on the number of new entrants, enrolled students and graduates . The default table displays data on enrolled students for the latest year available and for a subset of education levels. The selection can be changed to display data: by year, by intensity, by sex and measure (graduates).

For more information, please consult the Education at a Glance web page and the OECD Handbook for Internationally Comparative Education Statistics: Concepts, Standards, Definitions and Classifications.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_ACT_TCH.name: Teachers' actual teaching time
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_ACT_TCH.description:
This dataset contains data on actual teaching time of full-time teachers in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes). The table displays data in hours per year.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2024. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2024 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_ALL.name: Teaching and working time of teachers - full dataset
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on teaching and working time of teachers.

It covers full-time teachers in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes). The default selection shows all available measures of the OECD average.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2024. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2024 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_ACT_TCH.name: Teachers' actual annual teaching time
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_ACT_TCH.description:
This dataset presents data on actual teaching time of full-time teachers (including overtime) in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes). Data refers to the reference year 2020 (school year 2019/20 or 2020), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2022. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Annex 3 of Education at a Glance 2022.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_ALL.name: Teaching and working time of teachers and school heads - full dataset
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on teaching and working time of teachers and school heads.

It covers full-time teachers and school heads in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes). Data refers to the reference year 2021 (school year 2020/21 or 2021), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2022. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Annex 3 of Education at a Glance 2022.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_STA_SCH.name: School heads' working time
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_STA_SCH.description:
This dataset presents data on statutory requirement on working time (and teaching time, if applicable) of full-time school heads in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes). Data refers to the reference year 2021 (school year 2020/21 or 2021), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2022. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Annex 3 of Education at a Glance 2022.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_STA_TCH.name: Teachers' statutory teaching and working time
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_STA_TCH.description:
This dataset presents data on statutory requirement on teaching and working time of full-time teachers in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes). Data refers to the reference year 2021 (school year 2020/21 or 2021), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2022. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Annex 3 of Education at a Glance 2022.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_STA_TCH_REG.name: Teachers' statutory teaching and working time (subnational data)
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_EAG_WT_STA_TCH_REG.description:
This dataset presents data on statutory requirement on teaching and working time of full-time teachers in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes) for some subnational entities. Data refers to the reference year 2021 (school year 2020/21 or 2021), unless stated otherwise.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2022. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Annex 3 of Education at a Glance 2022.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_STA_TCH.name: Teachers' statutory teaching and working time
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_STA_TCH.description:
This dataset contains data on statutory requirements on teaching and working time of teachers. It covers requirements for full-time teachers in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes).

The default table displays data on teaching time (in hours, days and weeks per year). The selection can be changed to display data in working time (total working time or working time required at school, in hours per year).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2024. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2024 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

For historical data on statutory teaching hours, see Trends in teachers' statutory teaching time since 2000.

DSD_EAG_WT@DF_STA_TCH_REG.name: Teachers' statutory teaching and working time - Subnational entities
DSD_EAG_WT@DF_STA_TCH_REG.description:
This dataset contains data on statutory requirements on teaching and working time of full-time teachers in public institutions at pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes) in subnational entities of some countries.

The default table displays data on teaching time (in hours, days and weeks per year). The selection can be changed to display data on working time (total working time or working time required at school, in hours per year).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2024. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2024 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_WT_TREND@DF_ALL.name: Trends in teachers' statutory teaching time since 2000
DSD_EAG_WT_TREND@DF_ALL.description:
This dataset contains a trend of statutory teaching time requirement since 2000. It covers full-time teachers in public institutions in pre-primary, primary, lower secondary education (general programmes) and upper secondary general programmes.

The default table displays data in hours per year for teachers at the primary level. The selection can be changed to display data on different years and on different levels of education.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2024. Additional details regarding the methodology used, references to the sources and specific notes for each country can be found in Education at a Glance 2024 Sources, Methodologies and Technical Notes.

DSD_EAG_WT_TREND@DF_EAG_WT_TREND.name: Trends in teachers' statutory teaching time since 2000
DSD_EAG_WT_TREND@DF_EAG_WT_TREND.description:
This dataset presents a trend of statutory teaching time requirement since 2000. It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, teaching in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary education (general and vocational programmes).

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2022. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Annex 3 of Education at a Glance 2022.

DSD_EAG_WT_TREND@DF_EAG_WT_TREND_ALL.name: Trends in teaching time of teachers - full dataset
DSD_EAG_WT_TREND@DF_EAG_WT_TREND_ALL.description:
The purpose of this dataset is for download in CSV format. It contains the full raw data on the trend data for teaching time of teachers.

It covers teachers working full time in public institutions, working in pre-primary, primary and (lower and upper) secondary general education. Data is available from the reference year 2000.

For more information, please consult Education at a Glance 2022. Further detail as to the methodology used, the references to the sources and the specific notes for each country are available in Annex 3 of Education at a Glance 2022.

DSD_HCQO@DF_AC.name: Acute care
DSD_HCQO@DF_AC.description:
The Healthcare Quality and Outcomes (HCQO) data provides a systematic overview of the quality in healthcare – a core dimension of health system performance. They include indicators on the quality of Primary Care (Avoidable Admissions), Safe Prescribing in primary care, Acute Care, Integrated Care, Cancer Care, Mental Healthcare, Patient Safety, Patient Experiences, Mental Health Patient’s Experiences, and End-of-life care.

The indicators reported allow for assessment of whether the care provided is:

  • Effective: achieving desirable outcomes, given the correct provision of evidence-based healthcare services to all who could benefit, but not to those who would not benefit
  • Safe: reducing harm caused in the delivery of healthcare processes
  • Patient-centred: placing the patient/user at the centre of its delivery of healthcare

HCQO indicators also evaluate Access, Quality and People’s needs and preferences domains of OECD’s Health System Performance Assessment Framework.

Indicator definitions and calculation methodology of the HCQO indicators are available in the HCQO Definitions document.

Please refer to the Sources and Methods surveys on Acute Care (AC) and Hospital Data for detailed country-specific information.

DSD_HCQO@DF_CC.name: Cancer care
DSD_HCQO@DF_CC.description:
Effective cancer care such as early diagnosis, improved surgical techniques, radiation therapy and combined chemotherapy and their wider and timelier access contributes to increased survival of cancer patients.

Five year net survival is the cumulative probability that cancer patients survive their cancer for at least five years following diagnosis, after controlling for the risks of death from other causes, and taking into account that competing risks of deaths are higher among elderly people. The period approach is used to allow estimation of five year survival when five years of follow-up are not available. Cancer survival estimates are age standardised with the International Cancer Survival Standard weights.

Quality control and analysis for age standardised five year net survival were performed centrally as part of the CONCORD Programme, the global programme for the surveillance of cancer survival, led by the London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine.

DSD_HCQO@DF_EOLC.description:
